title: Chelsea: Eden Hazard and Diego Costa lark around with cardboard box in front of Antonio Conte at Cobham training session
text:
EFL Blues Cruise Chelsea: Eden Hazard and Diego Costa lark around with cardboard box in front of Antonio Conte at Cobham training session 
Hazard has been linked with Real Madrid move but Costa appears intent on keeping him by trapping Belgian in box Pictured Comments REAL MADRID might be after Chelsea star Eden Hazard this summer. 
But one man who won’t be letting him leave is teammate Diego Costa , if these hilarious snaps are anything to go by. Getty Images 4 Diego Costa appears to be keeping Eden Hazard out of Real Madrid’s clutches 
The Blues pair have been Antonio Conte’s top performers this season and it’s clear to see why they have such strong chemistry on the field as they larked around at Cobham on Thursday. Keep up to date with ALL the Chelsea news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Ever the joker, Costa somehow found a large cardboard box and proceeded to bundle Hazard into it, much to the amusement of their pals. 
Marcos Alonso and Nemanja Matic also joined in the hijinx as boss Conte watched on with a smile across his face. Getty Images Costa larked around as he trapped Hazard in a large cardboard box Chelsea star Eden Hazard makes the game look so easy - Even in REVERSE Getty Images 4 Nemanja Matic and Marcos Alonso joined in the fun at Cobham 
The Italian will also be hoping Hazard goes nowhere, with the Belgian’s ten league goals helping Chelsea open up an eight-point lead at the top of the table. 
Reports in Spain suggest Real Madrid have been deep in talks with Stamford Bridge chiefs for a number of months now. Related Stories BLUE INK Eden Hazard is Real Madrid's top summer target - but Chelsea star drops huge hint he will stay at Stamford Bridge Ed Start Chelsea superstar Eden Hazard 'on the verge of agreeing Real Madrid move after months of secret talks' Keep up with the Jones Chelsea boss Antonio Conte meets England rugby coach Eddie Jones, saying, 'It's important I gain future ideas' ON THE BOX Lincoln City's dream clash with Arsenal on BT Sport while Chelsea play Man United on BBC on Monday night Getty Images 4 Boss Antonio Conte managed to see the funny side of the situation 
And the La Liga hopefuls are allegedly growing close to a deal which would take Hazard to the Santiago Bernabeu next summer. 
The former PFA Player of the Year has made no secret of his admiration for Los Blancos boss Zinedine Zidane , but he is sure to be faced with a tough decision if Chelsea go on to win the league in May.
